#summary How to check out and build gnizr on your local machine
#labels Phase-Implementation,Featured

This page describe the steps to compile gnizr source code. Our current build environment is configured as the follows. 

=== Required Tools ===
  * Apache Maven 2.0.7
  * Apache Ant 1.6.5
  * Java SE Development Kit 6 (JDK 1.6)
  
=== Check Out Source Code ===

Follow the subversion [http://code.google.com/p/gnizr/source check out instructions].

=== Compile Source Code ===

Assume that you've checked out the source code in a top-level directory called `gnizr`.

  # Go to the top-level directory
    * `cd gnizr`
  # Compile gnizr projects and run Junit tests
    * `mvn -U install`  
  # Build clustermap applet JAR file. 
    * `cd gnizr/gnizr-clustermap`
    * `mvn -f pom-applet.xml -Dmaven.test.skip=true assembly:assembly`
  # Copy clustermap applet JAR to the gnizr web application project
    * `cd gnizr/gnizr-webapp`
    * `cp ../gnizr-clustermap/target/gnizr-clustermap-applet-2.2-jar-with-dependencies.jar src/main/webapp/applets/gnizr-clustermap-applet.jar`
  # Create gnizr web application
    * `cd gnizr/gnizr-webapp`
    * `mvn war:war`

*Note*: you probably want to modify various configuration files in `gnizr-webapp` before creating the WAR file. The default configurations may not apply for your local machine. _(todo: link to configuration file descriptions)_


=== Problems & Issues === 

Please report bugs and submit your questions to the [http://groups.google.com/group/gnizr-users Gnizr User Discussion] group.
